title: Welcome To My Blog
text: Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: SPMC350 Blog
text:
postseason


baseball


phillies











Nov 4, 2022


Madelyn Harris






No matching items

title: About
text: Sadly, I was born in Overland Park, Kansas, but I was raised in Lee’s Summit, Missouri (just outside of Kansas City). There I become an avid sports fan. Well, I strongly dislike soccer, but I love baseball, softball, football, hockey, track, and all that stuff. I came to the University of Nebraska to chase my Olympic dream of throwing the javelin in a team USA uniform. Nebraska converted me to someone that says “ope” and “you guys.” Currently, I am in a Sport Media class all about writing code and creating fun graphs. This class is a love/hate relationship in its truest form. Sometimes I cry while doing homework assignments, but moments later I created something pretty cool. So here it is, my blog.

title: SPMC350 Blog
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ──
✔ ggplot2 3.3.6      ✔ purrr   0.3.4 
✔ tibble  3.1.8      ✔ dplyr   1.0.10
✔ tidyr   1.2.1      ✔ stringr 1.4.1 
✔ readr   2.1.2      ✔ forcats 0.5.2 
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()

library(ggrepel)
mlbf <- read_csv("~/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-UniversityofNebraska-Lincoln/Fall 2022/SPMC350/SPMC350 Blog/GRAPHS and DATA/p1 data/fielding22.csv")

Rows: 32 Columns: 19
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (1): Tm
dbl (18): #Fld, RA/G, DefEff, G, GS, CG, Inn, Ch, PO, A, E, DP, Fld%, Rtot, ...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

mlbb <- read_csv("~/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-UniversityofNebraska-Lincoln/Fall 2022/SPMC350/SPMC350 Blog/GRAPHS and DATA/p1 data/season22.csv")

Rows: 32 Columns: 29
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (1): Tm
dbl (28): #Bat, BatAge, R/G, G, PA, AB, R, H, 2B, 3B, HR, RBI, SB, CS, BB, S...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

phif <- mlbf %>% 
  filter(Tm== "Philadelphia Phillies")
phib <- mlbb %>% 
  filter(Tm== "Philadelphia Phillies")
combined <- mlbf %>% inner_join(mlbb)

Joining, by = c("Tm", "G")

combinedphi <-  phif %>% inner_join(phib)

Joining, by = c("Tm", "G")

combinedpo <- combined %>% 
  filter(Tm == "Tampa Bay Rays" |Tm== "Cleveland Guardians"|Tm==  "Seattle Mariners"|Tm==  "Toronto Blue Jays"|Tm==  "New York Yankees"|Tm== "Houston Astros"|Tm== "Philadelphia Phillies"|Tm== "St. Louis Cardinals"|Tm== "Atlanta Braves"|Tm== "San Diego Padres"|Tm== "New York Mets"|Tm== "Los Angeles Dodgers")

ggplot()+
  geom_point(
    data= combined,
    aes(
    x= DefEff,
    y= OPS),
  color= "gray") +
  geom_point(
    data= combinedphi,
    aes(
    x= DefEff,
    y= OPS),
  color= "#E81828")+
  geom_vline(xintercept = .697, color= "#7BAFD4") +
  geom_hline(yintercept = .706, color = "#7BAFD4") +
  geom_text_repel(
    data= combinedpo, 
    aes(x= DefEff, y=OPS, label= Tm))+ 
theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 15, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    ) +
  labs(
    x="Defensive Efficiency", 
    y="On Base Percentage plus Slugging", 
    title="The Phillies are the worst defense in the playoffs", 
    subtitle="The Phillies can get on base, but have a hard time getting their pitcher off the mound.", 
    caption="Source: Baseball Reference | Madelyn Harris"
    )

title: SPMC350 Blog
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ──
✔ ggplot2 3.3.6      ✔ purrr   0.3.4 
✔ tibble  3.1.8      ✔ dplyr   1.0.10
✔ tidyr   1.2.1      ✔ stringr 1.4.1 
✔ readr   2.1.2      ✔ forcats 0.5.2 
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()

library(ggrepel)

allbatting <- read_csv("~/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-UniversityofNebraska-Lincoln/Fall 2022/SPMC350/SPMC350 Blog/GRAPHS and DATA/p1 data/allbatting.csv") %>% mutate(Name = gsub("\\*", "", Name)) %>% mutate(Name = gsub("\\#", "", Name))

Rows: 486 Columns: 30
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (4): Name, Tm, Pos Summary, Name-additional
dbl (26): Rk, Age, G, PA, AB, R, H, 2B, 3B, HR, RBI, SB, CS, BB, SO, BA, OBP...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

value<- read_csv("~/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-UniversityofNebraska-Lincoln/Fall 2022/SPMC350/SPMC350 Blog/GRAPHS and DATA/p1 data/value.csv") %>% mutate(Name = gsub("\\*", "", Name)) %>% mutate(Name = gsub("\\#", "", Name))

Rows: 427 Columns: 25
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (6): Name, Tm, Salary, Acquired, Pos Summary, Name-additional
dbl (19): Rk, Age, G, PA, Rbat, Rbaser, Rdp, Rfield, Rpos, RAA, WAA, Rrep, R...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

activebatting <- allbatting %>% 
  filter(PA > 100)
combined <- value %>% inner_join(activebatting, by = c("Name", "Age", "Tm", "G", "PA"))
phillies <- combined %>% 
  filter(Tm == "PHI")
bryce <- combined %>% 
  filter(Name == "Bryce Harper")

ggplot()+
  geom_point(
    data=combined, 
    aes(x=RBI, y=BA, size= WAR), 
    color= "grey",
    alpha= .3)+
  geom_point(
    data= phillies,
    aes(x=RBI, y= BA, size =WAR),
    color= "#E81828",
    alpha= .3 )+
  geom_point(
    data= bryce,
    aes(x=RBI, y= BA, size= WAR),
    color= "#002D72",
    alpha= .3)+
  geom_vline(xintercept = 38.77528,color = "#7BAFD4")  +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0.2376966, color= "#7BAFD4")  +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=phillies, 
    aes(x= RBI, y=BA, label=Name))+ 
  labs(
    x="Runs Batted In", 
    y="Batting Average", 
    title="The Phillies needed Bryce Harper to get to the Playoffs", 
    subtitle="Bryce Harper was one of the Phillies most influential players in making it to the post season.", 
    caption="Source: Baseball Reference | Madelyn Harris"
    )+
theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 15, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    )

title: SPMC350 Blog
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ──
✔ ggplot2 3.3.6      ✔ purrr   0.3.4 
✔ tibble  3.1.8      ✔ dplyr   1.0.10
✔ tidyr   1.2.1      ✔ stringr 1.4.1 
✔ readr   2.1.2      ✔ forcats 0.5.2 
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()

library(gt)

postphillies <- read_csv("~/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-UniversityofNebraska-Lincoln/Fall 2022/SPMC350/SPMC350 Blog/GRAPHS and DATA/p1 data/postphillies.csv")

Rows: 12 Columns: 18
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (1): NAME
dbl (17): GP, AB, R, H, 2B, 3B, HR, RBI, TB, BB, SO, SB, AVG, OBP, SLG, OPS,...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

post<- 
  postphillies %>% 
  select(NAME, H, HR, RBI, AVG, OBP, SLG, OPS) %>% 
  arrange(desc(AVG))

post %>% 
  gt() %>% 
  tab_header(
    title = "Bryce Harper led the Phillies to the World Series",
    subtitle = "Not only did Harper hit the homerun to get the Phillies to the World Series, but he leads the team in seven offensive stats."
  ) %>% tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) %>% tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) %>%
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Madelyn Harris  |  **Source:** ESPN")
  ) %>%
  tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=12)
     )
   ) %>%
  opt_row_striping() %>% 
  opt_table_lines("none")%>% 
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "#002D72"),
      cell_text(color = "white")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = NAME =="Bryce Harper"
    )
  )

title: The Phillies would not have made it to the World Series without the rule changes prior to the 2022 season
text:
Paragraph…


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggrepel)
mlbf <- read_csv("~/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-UniversityofNebraska-Lincoln/Fall 2022/SPMC350/SPMC350 Blog/GRAPHS and DATA/p1 data/fielding22.csv")
mlbb <- read_csv("~/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-UniversityofNebraska-Lincoln/Fall 2022/SPMC350/SPMC350 Blog/GRAPHS and DATA/p1 data/season22.csv")

phif <- mlbf %>% 
  filter(Tm== "Philadelphia Phillies")
phib <- mlbb %>% 
  filter(Tm== "Philadelphia Phillies")
combined <- mlbf %>% inner_join(mlbb)
combinedphi <-  phif %>% inner_join(phib)

combinedpo <- combined %>% 
  filter(Tm == "Tampa Bay Rays" |Tm== "Cleveland Guardians"|Tm==  "Seattle Mariners"|Tm==  "Toronto Blue Jays"|Tm==  "New York Yankees"|Tm== "Houston Astros"|Tm== "Philadelphia Phillies"|Tm== "St. Louis Cardinals"|Tm== "Atlanta Braves"|Tm== "San Diego Padres"|Tm== "New York Mets"|Tm== "Los Angeles Dodgers")

ggplot()+
  geom_point(
    data= combined,
    aes(
    x= DefEff,
    y= OPS),
  color= "gray") +
  geom_point(
    data= combinedphi,
    aes(
    x= DefEff,
    y= OPS),
  color= "#E81828")+
  geom_vline(xintercept = .697, color= "#7BAFD4") +
  geom_hline(yintercept = .706, color = "#7BAFD4") +
  geom_text_repel(
    data= combinedpo, 
    aes(x= DefEff, y=OPS, label= Tm))+ 
theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 15, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    ) +
  labs(
    x="Defensive Efficiency", 
    y="On Base Percentage plus Slugging", 
    title="The Phillies are the worst defense in the playoffs", 
    subtitle="The Phillies can get on base, but have a hard time getting their pitcher off the mound.", 
    caption="Source: Baseball Reference | Madelyn Harris"
    )

library(tidyverse)
library(ggrepel)

allbatting <- read_csv("~/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-UniversityofNebraska-Lincoln/Fall 2022/SPMC350/SPMC350 Blog/GRAPHS and DATA/p1 data/allbatting.csv") %>% mutate(Name = gsub("\\*", "", Name)) %>% mutate(Name = gsub("\\#", "", Name))
value<- read_csv("~/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-UniversityofNebraska-Lincoln/Fall 2022/SPMC350/SPMC350 Blog/GRAPHS and DATA/p1 data/value.csv") %>% mutate(Name = gsub("\\*", "", Name)) %>% mutate(Name = gsub("\\#", "", Name))

activebatting <- allbatting %>% 
  filter(PA > 100)
combined <- value %>% inner_join(activebatting, by = c("Name", "Age", "Tm", "G", "PA"))
phillies <- combined %>% 
  filter(Tm == "PHI")
bryce <- combined %>% 
  filter(Name == "Bryce Harper")

ggplot()+
  geom_point(
    data=combined, 
    aes(x=RBI, y=BA, size= WAR), 
    color= "grey",
    alpha= .3)+
  geom_point(
    data= phillies,
    aes(x=RBI, y= BA, size =WAR),
    color= "#E81828",
    alpha= .3 )+
  geom_point(
    data= bryce,
    aes(x=RBI, y= BA, size= WAR),
    color= "#002D72",
    alpha= .3)+
  geom_vline(xintercept = 38.77528,color = "#7BAFD4")  +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0.2376966, color= "#7BAFD4")  +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=phillies, 
    aes(x= RBI, y=BA, label=Name))+ 
  labs(
    x="Runs Batted In", 
    y="Batting Average", 
    title="The Phillies needed Bryce Harper to get to the Playoffs", 
    subtitle="Bryce Harper was one of the Phillies most influential players in making it to the post season.", 
    caption="Source: Baseball Reference | Madelyn Harris"
    )+
theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 15, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()

library(tidyverse)

── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ──
✔ ggplot2 3.3.6      ✔ purrr   0.3.4 
✔ tibble  3.1.8      ✔ dplyr   1.0.10

New names:

ggplot() + 
  geom_line(data= phigames, aes(x= `Gm#`, y= Rank), color= "#E81828") +
  geom_line(data= metgames, aes(x= `Gm#`, y= Rank), color= "#FF5910") +
  geom_line(data= atlgames, aes(x= `Gm#`, y= Rank), color= "#EAAA00")+
  geom_line(data= miagames, aes(x= `Gm#`, y= Rank), color= "#009CA6")+
  geom_line(data= wasgames, aes(x= `Gm#`, y= Rank), color= "#14225A") +
  
   labs(
    x="Game", 
    y="National League East Rank", 
    title="The Phillies were never going to win the divison", 
    subtitle="The Braves and the Mets fought for first place in the division until the end.", 
    caption="Source: Baseball Reference | Madelyn Harris"
    ) +

theme_minimal() + 
    theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 15, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10) 
    )
